definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China

sentences.english: To learn to type, seldom at ordinary times used phoneticize also was collected rise.
sentences.chinese: 为了学打字，平时不常用的拼音也捡了起来。

sentences.english: Shorthand and typewriting have been described as the twin arts.
sentences.chinese: 速记和打字被说成是一对孪生技巧。

sentences.english: The new typist is green at her job.
sentences.chinese: 刚来的打字员是个熟手。

sentences.english: A home-made typewriter costs less than an imported one maybe.
sentences.chinese: 我们国产打字机可能要比进口的便宜。

sentences.english: Most of the time, you never even realize your fingers misfired.
sentences.chinese: 大多数时候，你都发现不了这些打字错误。

sentences.english: Do you still have openings for the typist？
sentences.chinese: 贵公司还有打字员的空缺吗？

sentences.english: A really nice trick is to switch off your monitor when you’re typing.
sentences.chinese: 一个非常好的技巧是在打字的时候关掉显示器。

sentences.english: The typewriter rescued him, at least for a time.
sentences.chinese: 打字机挽救了他，起码一度挽救过他。

sentences.english: Janet pulled the page from her typewriter and looked nervously at her wrist-watch.
sentences.chinese: 简尼特从她的打字机里抽出纸，紧张地看了看手表。

sentences.english: Typing too fast caught the keys of Remington 1 pressed together.
sentences.chinese: 过快的打字速度会使雷明顿1型的字母健挤压到一起。

sentences.english: A: I am fed up with typing eight hours a day.
sentences.chinese: 我对每天打字八小时烦透了。

sentences.english: What is the rent for a type-writer?
The publishing firm was advertising for a typist.
sentences.chinese: 这家出版公司正在登广告招聘一名打字员。

sentences.english: She took up a sheet and ratcheted it into the typewriter.
sentences.chinese: 她拿起一张纸，把它哗哗啦啦地塞到打字机中。

sentences.english: I heard the typewriter clacking in the next office.
sentences.chinese: 我听见隔壁办公室中打字机发出嗒嗒的声音。

definition: speech sounds/pronunciation/colloquial (rather than literary) pronunciation of a Chinese character/phonetic/audio/voice/(Internet) to voice chat/voice message
to have difficulty remembering how to write Chinese characters
abbr. of 五筆字型|五笔字型, five stroke input method for Chinese characters by numbered strokes, invented by Wang Yongmin 王永民 in 1983
to err/to dial a wrong number/to make a typo
